snippet: Corporations don’t pay anywhere near their fair share in federal taxes. Fixing that is the first step to both fiscal — and economic — recovery.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof James Livingston maintains corporations should be taxed at same rate as individuals following Supreme Court decision that upheld their right to free speech; documents history of corporate taxation, pointing out discounted rates have failed to create jobs or foster robust investment.
lead_paragraph: Corporations don’t pay anywhere near their fair share in federal taxes. Fixing that is the first step to both fiscal — and economic — recovery.
